verses.verse: The Eternal Faithfulness of the LORD Oh, (1 Chr. 16:8-22, 34; Ps. 106:1; Is. 12:4) give thanks to the LORD! Call upon His name; (Ps. 145:12) Make known His deeds among the peoples!
Sing to Him, sing psalms to Him; (Ps. 119:27) Talk of all His wondrous works!
Glory in His holy name; Let the hearts of those rejoice who seek the LORD!
Seek the LORD and His strength; (Ps. 27:8) Seek His face evermore!
(Ps. 77:11) Remember His marvelous works which He has done, His wonders, and the judgments of His mouth,
O seed of Abraham His servant, You children of Jacob, His chosen ones!
He is the LORD our God; ((Is. 26:9)) His judgments are in all the earth.
He (Luke 1:72) remembers His covenant forever, The word which He commanded, for a thousand generations,
(Gen. 17:2; Luke 1:73; (Gal. 3:17); Heb. 6:17) The covenant which He made with Abraham, And His oath to Isaac,
And confirmed it to Jacob for a statute, To Israel as an everlasting covenant,
Saying, (Gen. 13:15; 15:18) “To you I will give the land of Canaan As the allotment of your inheritance,”
(Gen. 34:30; (Deut. 7:7)) When they were few in number, Indeed very few, (Gen. 23:4; Heb. 11:9) and strangers in it.
When they went from one nation to another, From one kingdom to another people,
(Gen. 35:5) He permitted no one to do them wrong; Yes, (Gen. 12:17) He rebuked kings for their sakes,
Saying, “Do not touch My anointed ones, And do My prophets no harm.”
Moreover (Gen. 41:54) He called for a famine in the land; He destroyed all the (Lev. 26:26; Is. 3:1; Ezek. 4:16) provision of bread.
((Gen. 45:5)) He sent a man before them— Joseph—who (Gen. 37:28, 36; Acts 7:9) was sold as a slave.
(Gen. 40:15) They hurt his feet with fetters, He was laid in irons.
Until the time that his word came to pass, (Gen. 39:11-21; 41:25, 42, 43) The word of the LORD tested him.
(Gen. 41:14) The king sent and released him, The ruler of the people let him go free.
(Gen. 41:40-44) He made him lord of his house, And ruler of all his possessions,
To bind his princes at his pleasure, And teach his elders wisdom.
(Gen. 46:6; Acts 7:15) Israel also came into Egypt, And Jacob dwelt (Ps. 78:51) in the land of Ham.
(Ex. 1:7, 9) He increased His people greatly, And made them stronger than their enemies.
(Ex. 1:8-10; 4:21) He turned their heart to hate His people, To deal craftily with His servants.
(Ex. 3:10; 4:12-15) He sent Moses His servant, And Aaron whom He had chosen.
They (Ex. 7—12; Ps. 78:43) performed His signs among them, And wonders in the land of Ham.
He sent darkness, and made it dark; And they did not rebel against His word.
(Ex. 7:20, 21; Ps. 78:44) He turned their waters into blood, And killed their fish.
(Ex. 8:6) Their land abounded with frogs, Even in the chambers of their kings.
(Ex. 8:16, 17) He spoke, and there came swarms of flies, And lice in all their territory.
(Ex. 9:23-25) He gave them hail for rain, And flaming fire in their land.
(Ps. 78:47) He struck their vines also, and their fig trees, And splintered the trees of their territory.
(Ex. 10:4) He spoke, and locusts came, Young locusts without number,
And ate up all the vegetation in their land, And devoured the fruit of their ground.
(Ex. 12:29; 13:15; Ps. 135:8; 136:10) He also destroyed all the firstborn in their land, (Gen. 49:3) The first of all their strength.
(Ex. 12:35, 36) He also brought them out with silver and gold, And there was none feeble among His tribes.
(Ex. 12:33) Egypt was glad when they departed, For the fear of them had fallen upon them.
(Ex. 13:21; Neh. 9:12; Ps. 78:14; Is. 4:5) He spread a cloud for a covering, And fire to give light in the night.
(Ex. 16:12) The people asked, and He brought quail, And (Ps. 78:24) satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
(Ex. 17:6; Num. 20:11; Ps. 78:15; 114:8; Is. 48:21; (1 Cor. 10:4)) He opened the rock, and water gushed out; It ran in the dry places like a river.
For He remembered (Gen. 15:13, 14; Ps. 105:8) His holy promise, And Abraham His servant.
He brought out His people with joy, His chosen ones with gladness.
(Josh. 11:16-23; 13:7; Ps. 78:55) He gave them the lands of the Gentiles, And they inherited the labor of the nations,
((Deut. 4:1, 40)) That they might observe His statutes And keep His laws. Praise the LORD!
